meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a dragon.
meanings.sent1: The toy dragon had a dragonish appearance with its scales and wings.
meanings.sent2: The castle was decorated with dragonish statues and paintings.
meanings.sent3: The dragonish costume at the party was a hit with the kids.
meanings.sent4: Her fiery temper was as dragonish as the mythical creature itself.
meanings.sent5: The stormy sky took on a dragonish hue as the sun set.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities or characteristics of a dragon.
meanings.sent1: The knight's armor had a dragonish design on the shield.
meanings.sent2: The dragonish roar echoed through the cave, sending shivers down their spines.
meanings.sent3: The dragonish behavior of the cat chasing its tail amused the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: His dragonish strength was unmatched in the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The dragonish eyes of the old wise man seemed to hold ancient secrets.
